TEST.TITLE: Domain 2. Water and Waste Water - Test 2

QUESTION.TEXT: What is the purpose of a percolation test?
QUESTION.OPTION: To determine whether a site is acceptable for an on-site wastewater system
To determine whether a site is acceptable for a domestic water well
To determine the absorption factor of water on a particular site

QUESTION.TEXT: What is the best supporting evidence to prove that a particular septic system is leaking?
QUESTION.OPTION: Presence of a colored dye in the effluent

QUESTION.TEXT: In calculating the size of a septic tank for a residence, what should be taken into consideration?
QUESTION.OPTION: Number of people living in the house
Number of people and animals living in the house
Number of bedrooms AND fixture units

QUESTION.TEXT: In a septic tank, bacteria do which of the following?
QUESTION.OPTION: Rid the tank of up to 75% of the pathogens
Separate the solids from the liquid

QUESTION.TEXT: Percolation testing requires that:
QUESTION.OPTION: The hydrological conditions of the area are taken into consideration
The size of the septic system has already been determined
Testing is performed only after it rains

QUESTION.TEXT: The "biochemical oxygen demand" is:
QUESTION.OPTION: The amount of oxygen needed by microorganisms to decompose organic matter in water
The amount of dissolved oxygen water needs to support microorganisms
The rate at which oxygen is dissolved in water
The rate at which chemicals deplete dissolved oxygen in water

QUESTION.TEXT: Which of the following most reliably indicates sewage pollution of water?
When planning a new rural subdivision, which of the following would be used to determine if both on-site wastewater systems and private water wells could be placed on each lot?
QUESTION.OPTION: The topographical conditions of the area
The hydrological conditions of the area
The proposed size of the residences

QUESTION.TEXT: A subdivision with private sewage disposal systems and water wells has had ongoing water supply and contamination problems in addition to a high rate of septic failures. The subdivision is adjacent to a municipality. Which of the following would be a good solution to these issues?
QUESTION.OPTION: Replacement of the on-site wastewater systems
Obtain permission to connect to the municipal water/sewer systems

QUESTION.TEXT: A local assisted living facility has a sewage back-up. This is a repeat violation from another inspection. Management is not being cooperative. What is the next step?
QUESTION.OPTION: Order the building be evacuated and closed.
Obtain a sewage sample and have it tested
Find who the owner is and attempt to contact for repair

QUESTION.TEXT: Which of the following could most likely result from exposure to untreated sewage?
Which of the following is a direct result of an excess of nitrates in drinking water and food?
You may see a mound system installed when which of the following limiting conditions exist:
Which of the following soil types is most suitable for an on-site wastewater system?
Which of the following would have the greatest effect on lowering suspended solids in effluent?
QUESTION.OPTION: A grease trap and septic tank in series
A two-compartment septic tank which is sized twice as large as requied
A septic tank with an effluent filter

QUESTION.TEXT: Which of the following is correctly matched with its descriptive term?
Calculate the liquid capacity of the following tank: five feet wide, nine feet long and depth of three feet nine inches
Which of the following is best used for finding leaks in septic tanks/systems?
Which of the following are most collected at a sewage treatment plant?
Which of the following matches the characteristics of a stabilization pond?
What is the primary function in a domestic septic tank?
Which of the following are found in septic tank effluent?
What can digested sludge be used for?
Which of the following is NOT associated with anaerobic conditions?
Which of the following is NOT associated with aerobic conditions?
The ground is pre-soaked prior to running a percolation test the percolation test. 17 hours later the percolation test is conducted. Following is the resulting data:
QUESTION.OPTION: The data indicates the site is suitable for an on-site wastewater system.
The data indicates the percolation rate is too fast.
The data indicates the percolation rate is too slow.

QUESTION.TEXT: What is the definition of soil depth?
QUESTION.OPTION: Top of the soil to limiting subsurface condition (bedrock, groundwater, etc.)
Surface area of the soil, including area where limiting conditions exist
Subsurface area of the soil, including only the first soil horizon
Depth at which the effective area of the leach field is placed

QUESTION.TEXT: Define soil profile
QUESTION.OPTION: A report of what each soil horizon consists of
What the surface soil consists of
A summary of the hydrological features of the soil

QUESTION.TEXT: What should be done when a lot is proposed as a site for an on-site wastewater system?
QUESTION.OPTION: Evaluate for limiting surface and subsurface conditions

QUESTION.TEXT: Which of the following type of on-site system would be given highest priority in the event of a failure?
QUESTION.OPTION: System sized for 450 gallons per day, residential
System sized for 1,000 gallons per day, commercial
System sized for 250 gallons per day, commercial
System sized for 1500 gallons per day, residential

QUESTION.TEXT: What would be a direct effect of the introduction of sewage into a body of water?
A soils survey is highly regarded in land use and municipal planning for which of the following reasons?
A plumbing vent is used to accomplish which of the following?
QUESTION.OPTION: Prevents water from being siphoned out of the trap
Helps prevent sewer gas from entering the building

QUESTION.TEXT: Which of the following MOST affects the ability of chlorine to disinfect?
Which of the following is NOT an accepted method for controlling mosquito breeding in water features/bodies of water?
QUESTION.OPTION: Treatment of water with appropriate larvicide
correct management of the pool level and filtration

QUESTION.TEXT: As water temperature increases, what is generally likely to happen?
Which of the following most enhances the aerobic condition in a pond?
What percent of wastewater is water?
A sewage system, if working properly, should transport wastewater at what speed?
What is the name for the solid portion of wastewater?
What is the gathering of fine particles to form large particles known as?
Eutrophication is caused by what?
What function does the grit chamber serve in a wastewater plant?
What are coliforms?
What is a young lake known as:
When there is a need to divert effluent into different areas of an absorption field, a(n) ___________ is used
At a wastewater plant what is the comminutor used for?
pH meters are sometimes installed in sewer systems in order to detect what?
How does eutrophication affect a lake?
QUESTION.OPTION: Decreased bacterial activity, decreased BOD, resulting in aquatic die-off
Increased bacterial activity, decreased DO, resulting in aquatic die-off
Increased bacterial activity, decreased BOD, resulting in aquatic die-off
Decreased bacterial activity, decreased DO, resulting in aquatic die-off

QUESTION.TEXT: Bar screens are used:
QUESTION.OPTION: For removal of sand and gravel
